meanings.definition: The quality or state of being rigid.
meanings.sent1: Her rigidness made it difficult for her to adapt to new situations.
meanings.sent2: The tree's rigidness prevented it from swaying in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The rigidness of the ruler's straight edge made drawing perfect lines easy.
meanings.sent4: The rigidness of the frozen lake warned of the danger of walking on it.
meanings.sent5: The rigidness of the metal rod made it ideal for supporting heavy weights.

meanings.definition: The inability to bend or be flexible.
meanings.sent1: His rigidness in negotiations led to a stalemate.
meanings.sent2: The rigidness of the old rubber band made it snap when stretched.
meanings.sent3: The rigidness of the frozen pizza dough made it impossible to shape.
meanings.sent4: The rigidness of the frozen ground made digging a hole a challenge.
meanings.sent5: The rigidness of the frozen lock prevented the key from turning.

meanings.definition: Strictness or inflexibility in rules or regulations.
meanings.sent1: The rigidness of the school's dress code caused frustration among students.
meanings.sent2: The rigidness of the company's policies left little room for creativity.
meanings.sent3: The rigidness of the traffic laws made it hard for drivers to navigate smoothly.
meanings.sent4: The rigidness of the schedule did not allow for any changes.
meanings.sent5: The rigidness of the law enforcement's procedures ensured order in the city.
